segments.text: nothing special . how about you ? Are you used to the life here in the States ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: everything has been fine for the past several months .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: well , I wish someone could talk to me about Western table manners
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: sounds interesting . Where did you get the idea ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: as you know , table manners in China are quite different from those of Westerners .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: absolutely . that's because both of us have distinctive cultural features .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: for example , in China , it's okay to talk while eating . However , you may regard it as rude .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: yes . this must be a huge difference .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: can you think of anything else ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: sure . We tend to think that the slower on eats , the more polite one seems .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: and we never sip or slurp the soup loudly . we quietly like little mouthfuls .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: i got it . i'll bear it in mind .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: don't worry . i'm sure our etiquette will become a natural part of your behavior as time goes by .
segments.speaker: S2
